review.reviewBody: Husband got me these a month ago for my B-day, I have been wanting them since last season. It's not exactly cold out yet, but the past couple of weeks It has been in the 50's when I take the dog for the morning walk and I have worn these. They are clearly meant for much colder conditions but they don't make my feet feel too warm even still. I like to wear my Uggs without socks and these are no exceptions, the fur lining covers the entire inside, most snow boots this is not the case which is my favorite thing about these boots! No socks and enjoy the fur lining!
review.name: I wear these on morning walks everyday from fall to spring!

review.reviewBody: Was hoping the other reviews about the boots fit being odd weren't applicable to me, but they were right. I wear a 6.5, got a 7.5 and the boot was extremely tight over the bridge of my foot and I do not have wide feet. I don't even think the next size up would have helped. Too bad because they are cute.
review.name: Returned

review.reviewBody: you will have all of my money if u make these in sand please and thank you ❤️
review.name: I love them but NEED THEM IN SAND COLOR

review.reviewBody: It fits great is super warm as I was hoping, it looks stylish, top quality.
review.name: I would buy this product again and again.

review.reviewBody: Way to tight on top of my foot... Really bummed me out considering there cute and seemed warm..
review.name: Would not buy again

review.reviewBody: I had to buy her another pair different color because she likes them so much
review.name: My wife loves the boots

review.reviewBody: I have had these boots for a few years and they are great winter boots! I love my classic Uggs for cold temps but we get a lot of snow here and these keep my feet warm and dry walking through deep snow! My only real complaint is that hey can be hard to put on and take off, because of this I usually tie them just tight enough to stay on but loose enough to take off without undoing. Because of the fur lining I usually slip them on without socks and have never had any blister issues, even when walking longer distances. Overall they are great for everything from running errands, snowmobiling and winter hiking. Funnily enough I even once wore them on a few mile walk on this muddy trail in the middle of summer, Its a long story but they handled the mud nicely and didn't even get my feet too hot!
review.name: Great winter/snow boots!

review.reviewBody: I have had these boots for over 5 years and they are still very warm, comfortable and look great. I would say they fit true to size. I am a size 8 and they fit me perfectly. My only complaint is that the laces take a long time to do up. I have little kids and a dog so I like something a little easier to get on and off. I love the look of the laces but if I had the choice, I would add a zipper.
review.name: Comfortable, Warm and Nice Looking

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for, for these Minnesota winters. They are both comfortable and warm.
review.name: Exactly what I was looking

review.reviewBody: These are so comfortable and stylish at the same time, runs true to size and will work for this upcoming Buffalo NY weather, great buy.
review.name: OMG a must I must buy the brown ones

name: Adirondack III Tall Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody: Originally bought a M because I wanted them loose enough to layer and keep me warm under shell snow pants, too big so I ordered my true size small that they fit great. Does the job for an extra layer when it extra cold!
review.name: Great layer

review.reviewBody: I got these as I was tired of putting on 4 layers of leg base when it it crazy cold. They really provide good warmth, still wear a pair of merino under on single digit days but very happy. Did not experience any of the snap issues mentioned, they do have a slight pooch in the front but not worth deducting a whole star for. Highly recommend.
review.name: Great layer

review.reviewBody: I love these! I get chilly skiing and these are perfect to wear under my ski pants. They stay out of my boots so don't add bulk and add the perfect amount of warmth. These are my every-day ski base layer!
review.name: Perfect for skiing

review.reviewBody: Received Wolverine insulated 3/4 pant as a gift. The side zippers and snap buttons are too large or perhaps exposed to be right next to skin. They dig into my waist/hips when wearing and especially bulky and painful when worn as base layer under ski pant shell. A soft elastic waistband would be more appropriate and comfortable. I wear XS and the size fits well. Even if I went into a Small the zipper tabs and snaps would be too bulky and painful.
review.name: Warm but zippers and waist uncomfortable

name: Wolverine Cirque 3/4 Insulated Pant - Women's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Pelican IM 70QT Elite Cooler online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Usage:
This thing has great insulation. It has easily kept block ice through several four day spring camping trips in the 40s/70s for a family of 4. Will be taking it on a week long trip in warmer temperatures soon.

Size/Weight:
No issues fitting it in any NPS bear lockers so far even though it?s enormous but for sure check the dimensions of the bear lockers where you?re going. It is hard to peer into it while inside the locker but definitely possible if you need to grab something quickly. It?s extremely heavy when loaded and definitely requires 2 people to move. 

Child Safety!
This thing is huge and both my children (<5yo) climbed inside as soon as it was delivered. I store it away from children and with the drain plug out since the nature of coolers (especially big ones) make them a suffocation hazard.

Features:
Drain plug and latches work great - especially the latches. They?re easy to use and seem to be bombproof. I don?t fish but I guess if I ever need to measure something while I?m camping I can lay it on the cooler. It also looks cool or whatever but I can?t admire it because it?s always in a bear locker ?????

Would be cooler if the cup holders were a larger size  like most reusable water bottles but they look perfect for beer.
review.name: Simple and functional

name: IM 70QT Elite Cooler

review.reviewBody: I ordered 2 Hershel items and received someone else’s order (a men’s sweater). I immediately called to report this and was told my items would be sent asap and to please send back the shirt. I did so right away with the label provided, yet my items were MIA. I called twice to inquire and once was told I would have them in 2 days. Finally an agent let me know they actually wouldn’t send my items until they received the sweater. I was livid. It had been 2 weeks at this point. I’ve never encountered such disingenuous customer service, ever. Two agents lied to me. I asked for a refund and told them to keep the items. The customer service team clearly needs new management.
review.name: Awful delivery and customer service
comment: We are sorry to hear about the mix-up with your order and the difficulties you experienced with our customer service. We have sent you an email to discuss this further.

name: Heritage 2L Crossbody Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Definitely good quality. When comparing the fabric to my brother’s Jansport, it’s clear where the extra cost is coming from.
review.name: Definitely good quality. When comparing

review.reviewBody: I really wanted to love this backpack, but it has a major design flaw. The backpack straps are attached to another piece of fabric that stretches across the top of the bag, not directly to the bag itself. As a result, the extra fabric/straps dig into your neck and shoulders when empty and fully loaded. If you loosen the bag, the extra fabric will lay flat, but the back of the backpack itself doesn't lie against your back. Super disappointed. I'm a relatively lean person (5'10, 140lbs), so maybe someone with a bigger upper body wouldn't have this issue, but I don't understand why they didn't attach the straps directly to the bag like their other packs. Sending back.
review.name: Really wanted to love it - major design flaw

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sure, it carries my work things with ease and always with room for more. But, I just learned this weekend that it can hold 18.2 lbs of books from a big ol' time at the thrift store - 27 total - without breaking my back. Distributes weight beautifully!
review.name: Sure, it carries my work

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Feels super solid and premium. I absolutely love it!
review.name: Feels super solid and premium.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this pack. Very roomy. Easily could be a weekender bag. Another great design by Osprey.
review.name: Love this pack. Very roomy.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wish you would have had a darker color available (black) - but other than that, the bag is great and I love using it as my everyday backpack.
review.name: I wish you would have

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for a travel backpack. I have an osprey day pack and love it. This is the perfect size and has some great pockets! Was a good price too (love that about Osprey). The only thing that is a little tricky is the water bottle pocket. It only fits a very thin water bottle and isn’t super easy to get your water bottle in and out of.
review.name: I was looking for a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This bag is great! I use it daily as a teacher moving between classrooms and it has plenty of space for all the things I might need. I really enjoy the separate laptop zipper compartment and the overall quality of the bag in the first 3 months of use.
review.name: This bag is great! I

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am absolutely obsessed with this backpack. I love hour it keeps it form even when there isn’t smudging in it. I love how many compartments that it has throughout the pack. 
I have had the backpack for about a month and I have packed a lot in it and the quality of the the material makes it feel like everything is going to hold for a long time. The straps are the softest straps out of all my bags. 
Looking forward to this being my daily bag for years to come.
review.name: I am absolutely obsessed with

review.reviewBody: I purchased this item over a month ago and require an exchange for a larger size due to a fit issue. Despite making four attempts to contact both ExpertVoice and the retailer, I have yet to receive a response. It has now been over a month, and I strongly advise against engaging with this company if you anticipate needing to make any exchanges.
review.name: No RESPONSE at All!!

review.reviewBody: Bought this jacket for wife. She loves how light and warm it is, even in the Minnesota Winter. Highly recommend this purchase with the comfort of knowing that the jacket will keep you warm in below freezing temperature. The hood is also an additional feature/reason as to why this is a smart buy as it protects you from the strong winds as it covers your neck and gives enough space to zip all the way up and be comfortable.
Great fit and style. Was not wanting a hood, but the fit is great and not too bulky.
review.name: Perfect fit

review.reviewBody: It is not as bulky as it looks like in the picture. It is really warm. I bought the yellow color ( cheetah ) and couldn’t be more happier as the color is nice. Material is excellent with a little stretch into it. Jacket is really well made.
review.name: Warm

review.reviewBody: On winter hikes I wear this with a fleece and base layer, I end up over heating and remove the fleece entirely. Super light weight, and a go to in my closet.

Really nice quality jacket.  Fits slightly large.  The hem is not cinch-able, but has an elastic band.  I'm broad shouldered and narrow hipped, so this didn't work for me.  But, for the right figure this would be an awesome jacket.  (I'm an XL chest and M/L waist/hip)
review.name: Excellent jacket for the price

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket for my sister for Christmas,  but I had my wife put it on and check it out beforehand.  reference. Is a small and my wife is 5'2 135lbs for reference. The waist was a good fit, but the arms were to short. She would need this in a medium. My sister on the other hand walks around 7 miles a day in northern California even in the winter. She needs a warm jacket for this season and this will be perfect. The quality is obvious just holding it. Extremely light. Almost like you're wearing nothing.  The cuffs hold the wrists snuggly to keep the wind out. She is going to love it, and I like the color to keep her visible to oncoming cars. Good buy.
review.name: Alaskan Arborist

review.reviewBody: Great jacket. The fit and size was perfect. Definitely recommend.
Wore this in freezing temps hiking the white mountains. It was perfect, comfortable, light, warm, blocked the wind, and fit perfectly!  Sry happy with the quality and overall with the purchase!
review.name: Gold

review.reviewBody: I love the quality of mammut. This jacket is warm and rain resistant enough for most PNW days. I like the length as it is longer than some of my other jackets.
review.name: Great fit and warmth

name: Albula IN Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Great flat light lens, and the 4D mag field of vision is amazing
review.name: Great goggle/lens

review.reviewBody: Three lenses in a row with the same problem of moisture not being kept out by the seal. I've been using Smith goggles exclusively for 20 and this is the worst product yet. Very disappointing for such an expensive lens/goggle.
review.name: Seal breaks, leaks moisture

review.reviewBody: This replacement lens seems to have a milky film on the inside. Like I'm looking through a protective plastic wrap that I can't remove. It's a replacement for a 4D mag that I scratched and the old one does not have this problem, so there must be a manufacturing defect.
review.name: Has a milky film-like coating on the inside of the lens

review.reviewBody: This is going to be my second lens replacement of the ChromaPop Photochromic Rose Flash -- fogging, condensation and collecting water in between the lenses. I had it replaced last year and haven't had the chance to use it until now -- the replacement lens has the same problem. It was very frustrating as I paid premium for these lenses. It really put a damper on my experience on the mountain. I wonder if there is an ongoing design or manufacturing issue. A number of individuals have reported it on Reddit too. The lenses are left to air dry at the end of the run.
review.name: Condensation and fogging in between lenses

review.reviewBody: Provides better vision in low light (fog, snow, rain)
review.name: Provides better vision in low

review.reviewBody:
Glad these goggles have replacement lenses. I scratched mine mid year last year during a particularly cold day when I tried to remove ice from the insides. It's nice to be able to just purchase a new lens and not a whole new pair of goggles.

However, it was a bit of a pain to get them. They were sold out last year and I put my email on an alert list when they got back in stock. I never heard back. Then I started scanning the site mid-summer until they got them back in stock, then I ordered them. Happy to have them though.
review.name: Great replacement lens - difficult process

review.reviewBody: The replacement lens is clear, unlike the original lens
review.name: The replacement lens is clear,

review.reviewBody: The ChromaPop Sun Black Gold Mirror lenses are by far the coolest lens color imo. They like something Master Chief from Halo would wear. The view from the inside is one of the most neutrally colored tints of all the goggles I've tried on. I don't care much for the purplish tint of some of the other Smith lenses, so it's a huge plus for me that these don't have that. They're definitely dark though. If there are any clouds in the sky, I go with the Everyday Red Mirror or Storm Yellow Flash lenses. Also, the field of view is amazing. If I'm looking straight ahead I can't even see the frame of the goggles in my peripheral vision except for the nose bridge. Some slight distortion where the lens curves down at the very bottom but I never notice this while skiing.
review.name: Fantastic Lenses

review.reviewBody: Love these lenses. Green always helps in the snow and how sturdy these lenses are makes them even better
review.name: Love these lenses. Green always

review.reviewBody: Excellent vision, rad look, superior quality, add the 4th dimension and these are out of this world
review.name: Excellent vision, rad look, superior

name: 4D MAG Goggles Replacement Lens

description: Buy the Patagonia Overlook Merino Wool Liner Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Overlook Merino Wool Liner Beanie
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Overlook Merino Wool Liner Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is OK but IMO barely suitable for large heads. I'm an XL hat size and this beanie is a very close fit. It'll work but it's quite thin to begin with and one wonders whether stretching it over my melon head and donning my helmet will quickly wear out the fabric.

There are better choices: I have a Gore Wear beanie that fits far more comfortably and seems to be more robustly constructed -- both beanies are about the same price.
review.name: Better choices for a large head

review.reviewBody:
This is a high quality lightweight beanie which breathes well, keeps my head (and ears) warm and feels amazing because of soft materials.
Definitely recommended.
review.name: Lightweight warm beanie

review.reviewBody: I've already worn it a few times, and I love it! I bought it to use with my helmet when I go mountaneering or for cold rock climbing activities, but I've also been wearing it daily to go to class, and it's just so comfy, and what I love most is it keeps me warm without heating my head which is something I can't stand. I'll update my review as soon as I practice the activities I bought the beanie for, and I'm definitely buying another one as a gift to my boyfriend.
review.name: Absolutely in love with it!

review.reviewBody: I love this beanie. It is thin and fits into a pocket easily but most importantly, is just a tiny bit slouchy so it doesn't hug too tight. So many beanies lightweight enough for active sports are really tight and unflattering and it's almost impossible to find one that isn't. This one is comfy and looks good. I use it for nordic skiing but imagine it would also be great for winter running. Not the right choice if you're looking for something really warm though.
review.name: Love, perfect for nordic

name: Overlook Merino Wool Liner Beanie

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultralight Self-Inflating Sleeping Pad - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ultralight Self-Inflating Sleeping Pad - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Ultralight Self-Inflating Sleeping Pad - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got mine and it is definitely not self-inflating. No matter how long it is left with an open valve, it doesn't inflate. It is comfortable but maybe too thin for my personal preference. Apart from that, it's easy to pack and is light.
review.name: Not worth its price

review.reviewBody: Used a few times in mid 40s overnights, and sometimes on gentle slopes. Held position, loved the non slip. Super comfortable for someone who dances in their sleep. Woke up like I would have from my own bed.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: This is a thin sleep mat and does not offer much cushioning, but that is not the point. It is just enough to even out the ground and protect from rocks. Very lightweight and packs fairly easily into the provided sack. The self-inflate function just needs a few breaths to fully inflate, and the deflate valve keeps it from reinflating as you roll it to pack up. Also, it floats! Great for alpine lakes.
review.name: Super lightweight and easy to set up and put away

review.reviewBody: This is the one thing on my gear list I personally implore people NOT to get. My dad talked me into it because the self inflating feature seemed novel, but this same feature has made this “women’s” pad nearly impossible for two women to pack back down into its stuff sack — making it an every morning hassle to put away — and its quite large and heavy when it’s properly put away anyways! I’m sure some people have had luck with this product, but it has proven useless for me because I can't get it back to it's initial size, even with the help of friends! Better off with one of the fold up economy ones than blowing big bucks on this.
review.name: Implore you not to buy

name: Ultralight Self-Inflating Sleeping Pad - Women's

review.reviewBody: I have worn these shorts for years.  Castelli has by far the best chamios for long distance riding.  Legs grip very well so they stay put.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Great chamois and legs stay put!

review.reviewBody: Got size based on chart, which is the size I get all my other bike shorts.  These were at least a size or more too small. Like wearing a griddle. I wear 8-10 in regular pants.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: I have issues with shorts riding up, waists digging in (or too loose), and a sore bottom - these shorts stayed put, the pad sat in a comfortable place, the waist band was perfect, and my bum felt great (after trying them out for the first time on a metric century - solid test)! Highly recommend spending a little more for more comfort.
review.name: Fits great and very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Ok, I have a lot of bike bibs and shorts. Probably too many. But who is counting when your bits are on the line? I was excited to try these. They are fashionable and the leg length is slightly shorter than others, making it good for, well, shorter ladies. I found the sizing to be slightly more generous than other models. I have Castelli velocissima and free aero shorts and bibs, both in medium, and these are smalls. They fit well on me and I have a muscular, non-curvy (read all quads/glutes and no hips) frame. The free aero chamois is superior to the velocissima but not by a lot. I figured that the KissAir 2 of these couldn?t be much different than the Kiss Air 4. Wrong. After an hour in the saddle I was crying. The chamois is stiff and unforgiving and doesn?t have the contour of the others. It was also sopping wet after my ride. Yes I use chamois cream. I am used to a lot of time in the saddle. I wish I could get that time back and enjoy the ride.
review.name: No no no ouch!

name: Sublime Limited Edition Short - Women's

review.reviewBody: Snappy and fun on the whole mountain. I love cruising long runs and hitting every side hit and jib in my path. The side cut on this board is really good! Super buttery board. As a big time park rider, if I had to choose one board to do it all at the resort, this is it.
review.name: In love!!

review.reviewBody: I ordered this board because in the photo it is black. And I received a white board. I’ve been on the search for this board with black coloring for my boyfriend and I was so disappointed when I opened it. Don’t advertise something a color when it’s a different color. Very upsetting

review.reviewBody:
Maybe Western Mountaineering was having issues in 2020/2021 due to Covid, but my 2024 is an absolute masterpiece. 

Consider this. The bags are full sleeping bags that are true to temp if not conservative, but they're only 2-4oz heavier than quilts. I'll find a way to save 2-4oz somewhere else and take a real sleeping bag, especially under 30F/0C

Something not widely known! -->  Western Mountaineering makes a bag extender that makes the bag more roomy and fits all their sleeping bags.
review.name: The two reviews from 2021 are odd...

review.reviewBody: Used it once so far, and it was only about 40 F outside, so didn't really give it much of a test in the temperature where it's supposed to be capable. But, love the feel and the comfort of the bag. The draft collars are awesome, too. Pretty sure it'll be toasty at least close to its rating. I've kind of given up on quilts; I understand the thermodynamics of down - this just prevents the drafts that the quilt straps couldn't overcome for me. And I think it'll be wide enough for me to move around and side sleep well enough.
review.name: This is a great bag

review.reviewBody: This bag is incredible! Bag is definitely comfort rated to 20 degrees. I have used it in 23 degree weather with a 3 season tent and was comfortable. The design of being able to shift the loft is really helpful. Neck collar and hood system work well to completely remove drafts. It’s expensive no getting around that, but what you get in price is something that will last, as well as work in conditions advertised. The weight is light. This is my best piece of gear and I love it. I have used it 4 times since I purchased it 2 months ago.
review.name: True to temp

review.reviewBody:
Easily the best sleeping bag I've ever owned. My previous down bag was rated to 16 degrees and was from a reputable manufacturer. With the old bag, I was comfortable down to about freezing (I'm a very cold sleeper). After using that bag for ~8 years, I decided to treat myself to an Alpinlite. The purchase hurt a little, but the bag is better than my old bag in every way. It is 1 pound lighter, and packs to probably 2/3 of the size. It is the same weight and packed size as a budget 40-degree summer down bag that I have. 

It is also much roomier. I'm a 6'3" dude and the Alpinlite is the first sleeping bag that I've felt was truly big enough to be comfortable as I toss and turn at night. The zipper has never ever snagged on me, and is the first sleeping bag zipper I can confidently use one-handed. 

As far as its performance,  I can use it (with a proper pad) down to the low 20s with only shorts and a t-shirt on. With proper baselayers and socks, it goes down to about 18 degrees comfortably. Colder than that, I've use down booties and a 50 degree synthetic overquilt and taken it to 6 degrees, albeit I did get chilly (but I was using a subpar pad).

Some have complained of the durability of the fabric, but I took this bag on a 6 week trip to Alaska involving over 20 nights of camping, and I had no issues. It is ultralight fabric, but as long as you don't abuse it, it will treat you well. Keep it away from pointy things and tent zippers. If you're really rough on your gear, maybe look at the WM Badger MF, which has a beefier fabric. 
 
It took about 30-40 nights of camping for it to start to smell, but your mileage may vary depending on your personal hygiene. The only true downside I've found with the bag is that it takes FOREVER to dry. Probably 8+ hours in the dryer on low heat. But this is due to how delightfully fluffy the down is, so it's worth it in my book

The expense is also notable. I don't believe the saying "buy once, cry once" when it comes to Western Mountaineering. Because once you buy one bag, you'll love it so much that you will want two or three more, for different temperature ratings. I have no doubt the Alpinlite will last me well over a decade, if not longer, but I love it so much that I'm now in the market for their 0-degree bag :(

I cannot recommend this bag and this company highly enough
review.name: Ultimate Cozy Goodness

review.reviewBody:
Some of the reviews have stated this is not a warm bag. WHAT? If it is 40 degrees or above it is actually too warm. WM bags are very conservative in their estimates.

I love this bag. So plush, well made and very warm. As I stated above, for higher temps I would actually go with a less warm model of a WM bag. WM bags are worth the money!
review.name: This is a very warm comfortable bag

review.reviewBody:
I've spent at least 40 nights out in my Alpinlite and I haven't had a cold night of sleep once. Even down to 10 degrees I've been warm as a bug in a rug. Anything over 50 degrees and I'm sometimes sticking one leg out to cool off. 

The bag packs down to about the size of a nalgene +15% and is extremely light. The loft on the down is awesome and it's extremely cozy and airy feeling.
review.name: Cloudy Warm Dream

review.reviewBody:
I had been dreaming of getting the "ultimate" of°sleeping bag brands for more than a decade, and after much deliberation and research, I finally pulled the trigger on the Alpinlite. My very first night backpacking°with it, the tent zipper snagged the outer fabric and ripped a hole in it (an indication of how delicate the shell fabric is). I nearly sobbed. I was able to return the bag, and I purchased another of the same bag. When I recieved the new bag, I immediately noticed it wasn't as lofty as the first bag I had, especially in the chest area. This concerned me, but I decided to try it out anyway. I used it on a weeklong trip in the Wind Rivers, and I was cold and uncomfortable every night. And oddly enough, my legs and feet were somewhat°warm enough, but my upper body was freezing. The first night the temperature was 39°°(I had a thermometer in my tent), and I was cold all night. The following few nights were in the low 40's, and I was uncomfortable enough that I didn't sleep well. I used this bag for 6 nights, and not once was I comfortable.°For reference, the pad I used was the Nemo Astro Lite insulated, with a temperature rating of 15°-25° F (Nemo didn't use an R-value for this pad. Also, I've used this pad for years and have never been cold with it). Each night°I wore thick,°warm socks, long thermal midweight°underwear, and a beanie. This is the same combination that I've used for years with my previous bag (a Marmot Pinnacle) and I've never been as cold as I was in this bag. I even tried shifting more down to the top baffles of the bag, but it didn't help. I also noticed there were many spots where there was no down, and I could essentially see through the shell material. So, I either got a lemon, or Western Mountaineering's quality control sucks (I weighed the bag on a gram scale and it was under spec, which indicates it was under filled). Or, this bag doesn't°live up to the WM hype. Either way - and most of all - I'm really extra°ticked I dropped $600 on a stupid bag that doesn't keep me warm. Oh, and one more gripe: this bag has a tiny hood. I like to use a pillow stuffed in the bag's hood, but the hood is too small for it to work well.°So, don't believe the hype, steer clear and save your coin. You'll thank me you did.°

Side note: dealing with Backcountry is the worst. I returned the bag and was expecting a refund, but they would only issue store credit (and never notified me). Chatting with their "woke", millennial°"Gearheads" -°who refer to you as "dude" or "man" -°is an excruciatingly painful and time-consuming ordeal. Thanks, Backcountry, but no thanks. I don't want to purchase anything from you. Oh wait, I have to because you're holding my money and are forcing me to.

If I were you, I'd get off this site right now.

Alex, they issued me store credit, which is different than a refund, especially when I don't want to buy anything from Backcountry. Ever. Also, I had no idea I recieved any store credit because they never emailed me and the mobile site doesn't show any credits anywhere. 

P.S., my disdain for Backcountry has no bearing on my review for this bag - it truly is a one-star bag (at least the one I recieved).
review.name: A bag of cold disappointment
comment:
Hey Seth!  I am truly sorry to hear about the experience with your bag--you are right that is not typical of WM quality and the bag should 100% have held up in the temps you experienced.  It does look like our Gearheads issued you a full refund however :)

Thanks for your feedback and hopefully we can make your next experience with us better!

Hey Seth!  Sorry to hear about your experience with the bag--you are right that sounds like an awful time in temperatures that should have held up to a 20 degree rating.  Our official policy is that for used gear, we provide you a full refund in store credit so you can put it towards a replacement or something else that would work better.  However we try to be flexible whenever possible.  I went ahead and reached out via email to see if we can hopefully help you out and get you taken care of.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this bag about 5 years ago don't get out as much as I would like but when I get a chance I go no matter what the temp,  first time used bag early season bow hunting temp got around 35 F. nearly froze to death had to get up in middle of night get dressed go for a hike to warm up, took sleeping bag back to store manager said he would take bag back.  I explained my situation with it that my back froze.  He'd showed me that the bag has no baffles and you have to shake the down to the proper place, so I tried that with a little better result.  Seems to me bag has great fill in toe box, neck curtain and head with very little on torso area.  I use bag in 4 season tent with heater now and as long as I run heater all night long I'm comfortable.
review.name: Good to 40 degrees at best
comment: After using this bag for a week, I agree 100% with this review (see my review above), especially with the comment about too little fill in the torso area. So, Robert C., no, not user error.
Something tells me this was user error.
May I ask what R rating your sleeping pad was/is?

review.reviewBody:
The needs of the backpacker are many, and often unreasonable. This bag weighs 2 pounds and for comparison some other things that weigh about 2 lbs include a small bag of rice, maybe a carton of milk, a desk lamp. For that little weight you get what is in my opinion, the best sleeping bag on the market.
What makes this bag stand out? First off, the brand name carries all the accolades and associations it deserves. The sourcing (ethical sourcing with audits twice a year), water repellency, and hands on/in house processes are second to absolutely none. My bag's even signed by the person who stitched it (thank you by the way).
The 850-fill down (a conservative estimate) kicks in like a human tortilla sized toaster oven. It is a 2lb space heater. Up to the draft tube and cinchable collar, this is a cloud of down designed to make sleeping while camping nicer than a night in your own bed. I don't think it would be possible for me to wake up grouchy or unsociable after a night's sleep in this so this is a gift to your camping buddies too! The only downside is the willpower I have to muster up to leave my portable sleep machine.
It's the little details that make this feel as if your best friend made it given unlimited time and resources. The 20 degree rating is conservative for one thing. I run warm but I was very comfy in this bag at 7 degrees with the right liner and sleeping pad (PS please invest in your whole sleep system). The zipper simply does not catch. I had to do some research on the abilities of the benefits of a continuous baffle and I thought WM's site put it best "On a warm night slide down below you for less insulation, and on a cold night slide more to the top for warmer sleep!" Works just as advertised based on a warm California trip and a cold Oregon one.
I camp quite a bit but I?ve only owned one sleeping bag before the Alpinlite. I dealt with many of the downfalls of a cheap sleeping bag - made with synthetic material rather than down so it couldn't pack as well and weighed more than it should. The zipper caught. Poor warmth compared to the temperature rating. I've tried out and borrowed at least a half dozen other bags without being blown away by any since that one gave out. After much, much, probably too much research I decided on the Alpinlite as a buy once, cry once panacea to my outdoor needs.
My inaugural trip with this bag was a 2 day trip up to King's Peak. This gift to lovers of the outdoors was toasty, wide, and like the embodiment of a warm hug. It hardly takes up any space in my pack and the weight is negligible. I knew immediately I had made the right purchase.
The price tag will undoubtedly throw people off, as it did me initially. I can say I've gotten my money's worth and more though. The quality of sleep, warmth, and the care that went into construction are simply outstanding. This is the bag I?ll be using for many years to come.

Update a year later: still going strong! This bag is my best friend in the times of covid. No signs or wear and no regreats.
review.name: King of the Mountain
comment:
So glad you love it, Ben!  Thank you!

Leta
Western Mountaineering Rep

review.reviewBody: I received 2 sets of these pedals yesterday.  I pulled a set out and took out one of the pedals.  If you are like me and don't feel comfortable with clip-in pedals or clipless pedals (which are still kind connecting your shoe to the pedal) and you're looking for a flat pedal for your road bike these aren't it.  My first thought was that they were super heavy.  My second thought was that there were no reflectors which I knew that buying them but I figured if they were light enough I could look past that and put in my own reflectors.  I did some research while waiting for these pedals to come in and it seems that at one point Shimano actually sold a reflector kit for them but that is no longer the case.  I put the pedal back in the box, taped the box back up and initiated a return.  There are lighter and cheaper alternatives out there that just happens to have reflectors already on them.  I just thought that surely these would be awesome because of the Shimano name but apparently that's the only thing Shimano about them...the name.
review.name: Shimano only in name

description: Buy the Nathan Zipster Lite Lumbar Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Zipster Lite Lumbar Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Zipster Lite Lumbar Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Too small. Advertised as "Fits most large-format smartphones" and "Storage Galore". Doesn't come close to fitting a Pixel 8, couldn't even jam it in. The zipper should span the full width of the pocket. I used Nathan's sizing guide and if I were going to buy another one of these I would size up rather than down. I can't imagine any modern phone fitting in this pocket.
review.name: Skip it

review.reviewBody: The idea of a space saving, elastic (tight to the body)  fanny pack goes back to Michael Nathan’s original concept which you have fumbled.  My purchase misses the mark: an iPhone struggles to be placed and if the phone  has a protective case it doesn’t fit at all. It’s useless. Why not make a similar front to back carry pack with space to fit a large mobile phone, a good sized wallet, and house keys. You’d be doing all of us a favor.
review.name: A little too little

review.reviewBody: It was too small and didn't fit right even though I followed the sizing guide. I ended up returning.
review.name: Too small
comment: Hello and thank you for your review of our Zipster Lite. I am sorry to see that yours did not fit as expected.  Please contact our customer service department at (800) 233-6956 or cs@unitedspb.com and we will assist you further with this matter.

review.reviewBody: My son used my zipster to run and loved it so I bought him one for Christmas!
review.name: 2nd purchase! Love this

review.reviewBody: Fit is great and works as advertised. Love that I don’t need to hold my phone or use an arm band! Holds all my gels too. If you are in the fence…GET IT!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great waist belt. Plenty of pockets for storing stuff and fits great. It fits my phone, keys, ID and snacks. Also it doesn't bounce. Great belt for the price.
review.name: Great waist belt for the price.

review.reviewBody:
Pouch too small for average phone.
That's the sole reason for the purchase !
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: Super light weight and comfortable! If debating go a size up, once it’s full it will fit better
review.name: Great Quality

review.reviewBody: I have had this exact running belt for about 5 years and it still holds up well. My only problem is the zipper part doesn't accommodate the newer iPhones, such as mine which is the 11 Pro Max. It will fit, but I can't take it in and out easily when I need to be able to. Would love to have a newer one but the zippered pockets definitely need to be bigger. Aside from pocket size, I 10/10 recommend this belt to anyone!
review.name: Great Product, Need bigger pockets!

review.reviewBody:
Love the Zipster Lite running pack! It is just what I needed to stash my phone and some lite items. Super slim lines and it is comfortable on your waist. No bulky belt clips  or adjusters necessary. Stay perfectly where you put it. 
My only complaint - the phone (Google Pixel) is a little tight to get it in and out.  It definitely fits, but you can just pull it out on the fly.
review.name: Almost Perfect

name: Zipster Lite Lumbar Pack

hasVariant.name: Mountain Suspenders
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Mountain Suspenders online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These suspenders are a big disappointment. I bought them because I wanted suspenders with very low profile connectors to my hiking/climbing pants. Most suspenders use large and bulky clamps/clips to secure them to a waistband, which tend dig into your waist under a heavy pack's hip belt. I thought the very low profile flat aluminum hooks used with these suspenders would be the perfect solution. Unfortunately, the open ended hooks easily slip out of the 1" webbing loops on my pants due to a miniscule upturned lip at the end of the hooks. Further the hooks have a split center bar that allow them to be removed - which also allows them to slip off the elastic suspender straps. The only (and totally unacceptable) solution I've found so far is to keep so much tension in the suspender straps that I'm wearing them like Steve Urkle! So now I'm on the hunt for double locking G-hooks to replace the OEM ones. All this trouble after buying a Patagonia product?!? For twice what any other suspenders I found cost?!? Yup, very disappointing.
review.name: Surprisingly Ineffective / Useless

name: Mountain Suspenders

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these shoes, especially the Bluetooth. I was surprised how many steps I actually took!!

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Cargo Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Good quality.  The rear and thigh pockets are very useful to carry your stuff.

Moderately compressive fit and decent inseam length.
review.name: Pockets Galore!

review.itemreviewed: FR-C Pro Cargo Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: FR-C are my go to bibs over Assos and others due to the FR-C chamois. Truly a 'forget it is there' bib. I was so excited to get some Giordan FR-C cargo bibs to wear on super hot training days so i could store food, etc. while wearing a tactical tee for a cooler ride. The bibs work, but there are serious problems. The most disappointing is the degradation of Giordana build quality. Both pair of the cargo bibs have seam threads unraveling -- the crinkly threads that start small but before you notice they are dangling 6".  I noted this on a regular pair of FR-C bibs as well, the most recent pair i bought. It appears Giordana build quality is going the way that Castelli was a few years back. Massively disappointing. Second, the back pockets over the hips are nearly impossible to open to get something in.  Third, while they appear to be the same height in the front (up well past the naval), I notice the cargo bibs in the front are not as comfortable and are HOT.  I do not notice this on the regular FR-C bibs or the FR-C Pro Lyte bibs.  VERY disappointing build quality, and the design is not top notch for the cargo features.
review.name: Love FR-C bibs but the build is poor

name: FR-C Pro Cargo Bib Short - Men's

review.itemreviewed: XA Pro 3D V9 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Within 8 months of light use walking around the neighborhood, holes developed (materials separated) in both shoes on the outside of the shoes by the toes (the area where the shoes bend). Warranty claim denied as "regular use on hard, flat surfaces, which is outside the intended use of this model". 

Don't buy these shoes unless you want to buy more shoes in 6 month. Planned obsolescence. If it cant handle light neighborhood walks, how is it actually going to handle trail running?
review.name: Warranty invalidated by use in Urban areas

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 6-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: Excellent new pot set! Did a 2 day overnight backpack trip on the Appalachian Trail with my niece and nephew. Great weight for all that is in there, and I love that everything fits inside the pot. That feature is super convenient and space saving when backpacking. I would definitely recommend you try this set!
review.name: Great new addition, same Sea to Summit quality!

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot 6-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody:
Upon receiving the 6 piece Sea to Summit Frontier Cook Set – everything about it suggests top quality. The packaging is robust and signifies that high quality gear is within. I took set on a 3 day/2 night kayak camping trip I was leading for a group of 11 people. I shared the kit with the group to get their impressions as well.

At less than 2 lbs (1lb 13oz) this set offers a very high value for the weight being carried. Admittedly, this was a kayak camping trip, so weight is not that big of a factor, volume is more important. The set fit easily within my kayak. 

The new Click-Safe handle design is brilliant although some people seemed to struggle with it at first. It is actually really simple to use and really makes the pot feel like a one-piece pot – super sturdy. The 2L and 3L sizes give you plenty of flexibility to prepare just about anything in the wilderness. While the strainer lids are becoming standard on outdoor cookware, they are integral to the frontier lids and worked really well for draining pasta. The addition of the Sea to Summit Frontier Ultralight Pan would make this a comprehensive cook set.

The pots cooked food nicely and seemed to have good heat distribution. I used the 3L to mix a cake mix that I was baking in a dutch oven and used a metal wisk to mix it. There were no marks at all on the inside of the pot – suggesting a very robust no-stick coating that will not scratch easily.

The inclusion of two nice bowls and covered cups is really nice. We used both the bowls and the cups on this trip. Although very light, they are sturdy and were easy to hold with hot food in them. The spill proof lids on the cups are a nice feature and the cups did well for both morning coffee and evening wine.

One comment/observation a number of people had (including the author) was that it would be nice if the set came in a bag (mesh or otherwise) to protect the outside of the 3L pot. The other comment I received from a few people is it was a little hard to see the graduation numbers inside the pot (maybe make them bigger for the next generation?).

All in all, this is a fantastic set that will delight the outdoor chef. It is well thought out and the new Click-Safe handle design is a winner – really makes it feel like a solid one piece pot. A thought on a bag – maybe Sea to Summit could list the recommended Ultra-Sil or Big River dry bag size as part of the product description?

Thanks again Sea to Summit for manufacturing well thought out, high quality gear!
review.name: Sea to Summit Frontier 2 Pot 6pc Cook Set - Initial Reactions

name: Frontier UL Two Pot 6-Piece Multi-Cook Set - 2 Person

This was the first one I've seen in years that I wanted to have. It is not flashy but it looks fashionable and unique. I bought it for its looks but I was pleasantly surprised how well thought out and functional it is. Slides on to my carry-on, has the right amount of pockets and padding, holds my Macbook Pro and the the bigger backup laptop.

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: My buddy and I each have one of these goretex pro bib, the thing is, his got teared from the back after a couple season and backcountry refuse to warranty this, and mine is not waterproof at all on a pow day.  For the pricetag, I would say get HH, flyflow other real brand instead.
review.name: Poor build quality and Not waterproof

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Pros: lightweight, decent pockets, great ventilation, and stays dry. 
Cons: construction quality lacks.  The seam on the butt completely tore open all at once while squatting down.  Touring gear needs to be beefier because if you blow out your pants in the backcountry then it becomes a survival and safety concern.  
    These are my backup bibs, so they weren’t used too often.  Also, the front fly is too small to use, so you have to unzip the side if you want to go pee.
review.name: Fell apart at the seams

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased a pair of "Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's" last year on sale.
The bibs are nice and comfortable, but it seems that the material is very fragile. The stitching on the inseam came undone. The price is not justified by the poor quality and short lifespan of the material. The bibs are really only worth it if you are purchasing the pants for just one season. I have never washed these pants and really have not worn them too many times.
review.name: Good for one season

review.itemreviewed: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Light weight great bibs! great fit and feel. sizing is true to size maybe a hair big
review.name: Great Bibs!

name: Cardiac GORE-TEX PRO Bib Pant - Men's

description: Buy the Rab Ridge Raider Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ridge Raider Bivy
hasVariant.description: Buy the Rab Ridge Raider Bivy online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Only used a handful of times. After 2 years no longer waterproof! Very disappointing fir the price.
review.name: Initially good until lost waterproofness

review.reviewBody:
First, let me say that the customer support of backcountry is incredibly good, supportive & understanding. The supporting pole that raises the canopy directly above the entry / exit snapped on my 1st attempt to put the Bivy together as a test run.  The dimensions allowing the pole to be inserted / released - in / from the side hole/eye (outside the bivy proper) are so tight, one has to apply so much force. The result is snapping of the pole. I hope Rab will introduce Rab Ridge Bivy II soon with a slightly expanded dimensions that allows the easy insertion & release of the canopy's supporting pole. Otherwise , it's an incredible product ! Second, a shout out to the Rab's support & service team for their awesome response in replacing the broken pole.  However, I had to return the Bivy back to Backcountry out of fear that the same experience would repeat (thus the two stars) on my 3 months out of country trip. Didn't want to take a chance.
P.S. the same snapping experience is also described by one experienced British camper who (wrote a thorough & long review of the product) also suggested to Rab that the dimensions should also be slightly altered allowing the easier insertion & release of the pole.
review.name: Weak supporting pole of Rab Ridge Bivy

name: Ridge Raider Bivy

review.reviewBody:
i was interested in this bug net as there were two different options to use this - as a full cover bug net, or as a quick entry half net.

unfortunately this net does not fit a standard 11ft camping hammock. the net is too short (leaving the last two feet of hammock exposed no matter what, and waaaaaaaaaaaaay too narrow - you'd have to lie down the center like a banana, would not make for a comfortable nights rest...

guess it would be okay if you had a short 9ft hammock, and you don't mind being cramped in a straight lay. but if you have any hammock experience and want to sleep using this net, i do not recommend this product.
review.name: does not fit full sized camping hammocks

name: Guardian SL Bug Net

description: Buy the Klymit Double V Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Double V Sleeping Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Double V Sleeping Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The company really kept their words. Lifetime warranty products. My Double V air pad had a leak. They sent me a replacement no question ask. Thank you sending me the new pad. I love the product light weight, comfortable and compact to travel with.
review.name: Happy with the warranty

review.reviewBody: Pretty great mattress, fit snug in my MSR 2 man hubba hubba. Only wish bag to pump in air was a bit larger.
review.name: Pretty great mattress, fit snug

review.reviewBody:
Have had this a couple of years and, while we are not frequent campers, we have used for four or five back-country canoe trips during that time. So... not an unreasonable amount of use... Nevertheless, mattress loses gradually more air each trip and a faster rate. Thinking this could be a simple fix with a patch kit, I inflated the thing and dunked it in my hot-tub.

What I found were at least five micro-holes in the awkward space where the "bubbles" on the mat are sealed. Given how many holes there were and the difficulty in sealing them, I decided to forgo playing whack- a-mole with my patch kit. Likely I&#x27;ll buy a competitor&#x27;s product.
review.name: Loses air over time. Not robust
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: I purchased this mat as a solution for my Wife and me sleeping together while camping. The First 2 nights we spent on it were great, and we had comfortable warm nights of sleep. However, on the last night, it deflated while we were sleeping which I thought was quite odd as the matt hadn&#x27;t been moved at all. Upon coming home I attempted to fix the "punctures" using a spray bottle and seam seal. However, after patching 6 or so areas I realized that there were 100s of tiny bubbles coming from most of the seams on the matt. In the photos, you can clearly see where the face material is delaminating and how the air is escaping. This is unfortunate as I love the other products I have from Klymit, this one just seems to be an EPIC fail, that is clearly not reliable to use in the field and has been cheaply constructed when compared to Klymits other products. If you are in the market for a Double-wide sleeping matt look elsewhere........
review.name: Failed on third use, Look Elsewhere.....
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: Great size, comfort, and weight. However, it developed multiple leaks in the zig zag seams after less than 15 nights. Klymit warrantied the mattress and sent me a new one, but that one developed the same leaks. I guess it’s just a poor design or materials. I don’t want to keep filling the landfill with warranties so I’ll look to another brand.
review.name: Leaks
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody:
Definately not worth the price. Started out well and was happy with the comfort, bag not really a pump. Only used a few times last season and 1st time this spring and started to deflate. Will not stay inflated for more than 5 min.Can&#x27;t find the hole, assuming it&#x27;s within the seams somewhere. The bag it comes in does not pump it up as shown in videos. You can blow it up quicker by blowing it up like a baloon. Turned in a repair or replace request, got a ticket email afterwards so we&#x27;ll see if they can stand by their warranty.

This seems to be an issue with this pad, maybe an issue for Klymit to fix or re-design.
review.name: Not worth the price...

review.reviewBody: Great for car camping or canoe camping. I'd want something lighter for hiking.

Starting with the specs it it very impressive. The quality of the sleeping pad feels great.  Compared to similar models from competitors, this sleeping pad gives you higher quality materials than I felt I paid for.  Very simple to use with a inlet and quick deflating outlet..  The storage bag also doubles as the inflator. For the thickness of the sleeping pad it is very comfortable.  This is definately a great option for back packing, I'm taking it to the Grand Canyon next month.  10/10 would recommend.
review.name: Perfect for Backpacking! Excellent quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've slept on it four times in the last two weeks, including once when the ground was super rooty. Very comfortable. It perfectly fits the floor space of my Dagger Osmo 2p tent by Nemo.
review.name: I've slept on it four

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've slept on it four times in the last two weeks, including once when the ground was super rooty. Very comfortable. It perfectly fits the floor space of my Dagger Osmo 2p tent by Nemo.

review.reviewBody: I would NOT purchase these again. I wanted to love these shoes but instead their lack of durability has turned me completely off. I walked in them less than 4x. I'm so bummed about these. :(
review.name: These shoes are a down right bummer and disappointment

review.reviewBody: Love the shoes. They are so incredibly comfortable! Great for long distance walking.
review.name: I would absolutely buy this product again!

review.reviewBody: I purchased these after loving the Lone Peaks, but these have a different heel fitment. Everything else about the shoe is great, but the padding for the heel seems to be quite low, while the heel collar comes up to the correct spot. They are very comfortable, just not as secure on the heel as I would like.
review.name: Odd heel fit

review.reviewBody: Got these to replace the timp 4s that I wore out walking every day. Long story short, these aren't as comfortable and have caused an issue with my achilles tendon. The back of the heel was the problem for me. Too high.
review.name: I wanted to love these!

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so comfortable. I love that they provide ample room in the toebox and feel secure at the heel. I am looking at getting a pair for road running as well.
review.name: I love these shoes!

review.reviewBody: I would never buy these again. They have become so insanely stiff. The first pair I had fit amazingly, were so comfortable, and I never had to "break them in". I loved them. Second pair, I sent back immediately. I am not sure why the shoes have absolutely no give and are so rigid? Going back to ON or Hoka.
review.name: Nope

review.reviewBody: I run trails and I have had a few Altra models: among them Olympus 4 (two pairs) and this 5: like many others also wrote, the heel pops out while running and it feels shorter than my usual size.
review.name: I'm returning mine

review.reviewBody: I fell in love with Altras in the last year. This is my third pair in size 9. I run on trails most days, and took these out for a spin. They felt a little short, but I thought maybe it was just me on the down hill. Alas, on a flat run it was the same. I couldn't send them back as they were super dirty so I gave them to my niece who is thrilled. I wish the sizing was consistent, but that's how it is sometimes. I'm on the fence about ordering this model again. The red is just so good looking. Still a fan, but a little inconvenienced.
review.name: Loved the color, but had to give them away.

review.reviewBody: I have a neuroma in my foot that can make walking painful. These shoes have allowed me to continue daily hiking without any discomfort.
review.name: I would buy these again

review.reviewBody: Loved the wide toe box of the lone peaks (1100 mi of PCT)But my feet get sore=>Olympus The heel cup was too shallow&the outer bit of my heal went thru fabric/plastic/foam of the heel @ 200 miles OUCH
review.name: After 250 miles, no thanks

name: Olympus 5.0 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've had this sweater in grey for a few years now. The fabric has been durable and so have the zippers and pockets.  It fits a bit tighter at the arms and isn't quite as soft or stretchy as I'd expected.
review.name: Durable recycled fabric

review.reviewBody: I took it to Iceland and wore it every day. It’s vented, lightweight, perfect amount of warmth. My favorite is a thin merino wool base layer underneath but I also wore it with no layer underneath on warmer days.
review.name: Love, Love, Love This Sweater

review.reviewBody: I own all 3 colors of this fleece and really love the style and functionality of the sweater but the green color (and only the green color) has pilling issues really bad - so bad I don’t even want to wear it.  I’m having to use a fabric shaver every time I want to wear it.  I’m guessing it’s just the color that shows it but I don’t have any issues with the other 2 colors.
review.name: The green color pills bad!

review.reviewBody: Love everything about this hoodie except the zipper. I takes me a few tries every time I try to zip it! Well, I've been at zipping zippers 40 plus years so I don't think it's my technique. I don't see any other complaints on the zipper here so maybe I got a dud. Not sure. Everything else about it is top notch though.
review.name: Great Hoodie but faulty zipper

review.reviewBody:
This had all of the makings of an awesome hoody. However, when I got it, the fit was just slightly weird. I've got an hour glass shape, so while the double zipper was nice, it didn't account for my bottom. I wish they would have used a more elastic ribbon at the bottom of the hoody like they did on my wool hoody from them. It fit, but was fairly snug.
Inevitably, I'm sending back because it's a lot of money for something that isn't all the way right.
review.name: Wanted to love it

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket. I knew it was not the warmest but it?s perfect for layering or for nights that just a little chilly. The glacier green color is so pretty! I bought a large to leave room for a sweatshirt underneath and it?s perfect. Also love that it cinches at the bottom to give a more fitted look if you like, and keep that cool air out!
review.name: Nice lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: This tightly woven shapely, warm and comfortable hoodie, I have in every color. It transports me from a day in the city to mother nature. It is the perfect transitional "go to" and I rarely go anywhere without it.
review.name: My all weather friend

review.reviewBody: Very light weight but hold warmth. This jacket has been my go to jacket all spring. Very comfortable and stylish.
review.name: My Go to Jacket

review.reviewBody: I wear this hoodie frequently as a layering piece and it is THE BEST for hiking, walking around outdoors, and even in a chilly indoors environment. It is multi-purpose and practical but also stylish. It ticks all the boxes, in my opinion!
review.name: Versatile and comfy and warm hoodie

name: Ovik Fleece Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: I love these visors—I have three colors. They are lightweight and dry quickly. I like that my ears are covered too. description: Buy the La Sportiva Genius Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Genius Climbing Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Genius Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Genius Climbing Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the La Sportiva Genius Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I have been climbing with these for about a month and i have noticed a few things. The shoes are much better than rentals but have a few set backs. The size  runs small, i have a 10 and I’m typically a 9.5 so you would think they are big, but unfortunately they are small. I know you want nice tight shoes but these are to the point where it’s uncomfortable. The next problem is why I’m giving these a three my feet are constantly getting stained even through the sock's. This has been causing irritation such that when i get home my feet are constantly itching, when i try to sleep my feet are just irritated, i have also noticed a rash here and there. I am disappointed to say but I need to now get a new pair of shoes ,and or look into some other brand's.
review.name: Not so great

review.reviewBody:
These are one of my favorite all around shoes for bouldering and sport climbing!

The lace closure system allows you to really dial in the fit and be extremely confident in heel hooking. The no edge technology takes a bit to get used to, but is amazing on any kind of sloping edge or small ripple in the rock.  Once you are accustomed to how the Genius performs, it will allow you to do things you wouldn't have thought possible in traditional shoes. 

These shoes allow you to feel precise without needing to be. If you have laser precision footwork, something like the testarossa or solution might give you a slight edge in precision on really small edges or pockets, but if you are going for an onsight attempt or are doing any amount of smedging the genius is a jack of all trades and the shoe I'd always choose.  

My other favorite shoe is the skwama. These shoes beat the skwama for me in terms of how much support and confidence they provide on small holds while still maintaining a similar level of sensitivity. 

In addition to sport climbing in the genius, I sent all of my hardest boulder projects last year in this shoe. As soon as I received my pair, it instantly took over for the skwama on almost all of my projects. 

As for sizing info:
My street shoe is an 11.5/12.5 depending on brand. (11.5 Hoka, 12.5 La Sportiva)
In Genius I wear the same size as Skwama (41.5), Half size down from Solution and Solution Comp (42). 
I wear size 11m in Mad Rock Drones, 10.5m in 5.10 Hiangle, 10.5 in Evolv Oracle, 41.5 in Tenaya Mundaka/Iati/Oasi, and 41 in Tenaya Mastia.
review.name: Go to for Bouldering and Sport Climbing!

review.reviewBody: I love these shoes! They are my go to competition shoes. The no edge makes the breaking in period so quick and the laces give the best snug fit. They do stretch quite a bit over time, but the laces allow for the perfect fit no matter how many times you have worn them. They are a very soft shoe so I do not use them for training as they would wear out quickly.
review.name: Favourite competition climbing shoes!

review.reviewBody: I would love to say it's a 5 star but unfortunately the heels has left me searching for other options. These shoes honestly can do anything else and perform as you'd expect, and even surpass expectation on difficult slabs. I'm a size 11.5 or 45 mens shoe and size down on all climbing shoes I have ever worn. I went for the size 43.5 Genius and find the heel remains loose even after sizing down. I suspect that as seen on the La Sportiva website that the shoe runs wide. be sure to size your heel width and toe box and check out the appropriate size for you!
review.name: Wide heel box makes heel hooks fail!

review.reviewBody: As a guy with a wider midfoot (US 10.5), I really appreciate the lacing system and extra room in the toe box compared to the other La Sportiva models. This shoe preforms best on delicate slab as well as steep, overhung rock like you'll find in the Red. It's also a great indoor shoe. I've sized down to Euro 42 but would probably go down to 41.5 with no problem.
review.name: Wide and Laced-Fit Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I have a climbing shoe addiction, so there are always too many options in my pack. I'm guilty of bringing 2-4 pairs of climbing shoes to the crag every time I go climbing, and I always like to include the Genius. This shoe continues to surprise me with what it can do, and what it can do well. I'm on my 3rd pair now, and they're on their first resole, a major bonus for these particular shoes (factory no-edge Vibram XS Grip II soles are available). Durability is amazing, despite the fact that these are some of the thinnest soles on the market. The front tip of the shoe is wrapped by the sole, which protects the rand and expands the climbing surface area of the shoe. It increases what you can do with your footwork and how you can maintain tension/pressure without damaging the rand rubber. They take some time to break in, but once you're there, the fit is exceptional. I like to use these for hard sport climbing, but they can jam cracks really well and smear on desert sandstone better than almost anything else. Stiff enough for support on roped climbing, and soft enough for delicate footwork, there isn't much this shoe can't conquer. My favorite application is granite, these stick to anything with crystals.
review.name: Perennial Favorite

review.reviewBody: This is by far my favorite shoe for indoor rock climbing.  The sensitive no edge toe box is great for standing on volumes and feeling every foot hold.  The shoe toe hooks better than any other lace up.  The heel is slightly stiff out of the box but breaks in quite fast.  The laces move very smoothly through the shoe and they feel more like a cinch up shoe.
review.name: Best Comp Shoe

review.reviewBody: I climb primarily outdoors and tend to prefer shoes with traditional edges typically. However, having spent some time on an extremely water polished low friction smooth limestone wall, the no edge technology greatly outperformed traditional edge shoes. I'm able to trust my feet on the worst footholds I've ever stood on! It did take me a bit of practice to get used to the no edge technology as the technique of how to place my feet is a bit different than a regular edge shoe. I haven't experience any durability issues with the Genius. I climb quite a lot and they last around a season of usage, the same as any other shoe I've ever worn. I can imagine the rubber wearing out faster than a regular shoe if I climbed in the Genius the same way as I climb in an edge shoe but the beauty of the no edge rubber is that more of the rubber can be utilized effectively and the rubber tends to wear out more evenly as opposed to an edge shoe where it's always the big toe that wears out.
review.name: Amazing Specialty Shoe

review.reviewBody: Love this shoe but it’s falling apart after 3 days of use. The sole is disconnecting from the shoe.
review.name: Fragile but sends

review.reviewBody: I had 2 pairs of Solutions delaminate on me after less than 2 months, then the third time I decided to skip out on the solution all together. After a bit of research found that the Genius is essentially a Testarossa re-designed. The Genius fit my wide forefoot, and narrow heel very well. I really like the slipper fit that they have, and I don't even tie them up unless I know I have to heel hook. Had mine for 7 months now, I climb about 2-3 times a week in the gym alone and they haven't shown any significant wear. Very impressed with the durability. The only sign of wear is the LS logo rubbing off. The No-Edge is great too, I notice the sensitivity a lot and it gives you that confidence to trust microchips. But if you accidentally kick you foot into the wall, you really feel it. The color is loud and flashy, so bonus if you like that. Overall a great shoe that I would buy again. The performance, and fit is great enough that I can overlook the price.
review.name: Wide fit and very sensitive

name: Genius Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: These wheels are simply awesome!!!  Very easy to setup running tubeless.  Everything needed was already included in the box (except for tires).  Already seeing a significant difference in both weight and speed retention over stock wheels.  Enve ID360 hubs and aerodynamic bladed spokes a plus.  Super fast shipping by Backcountry...great customer service!!!  Wheels also come with a lifetime warranty on manufacturing defects (original owner) and 5 year crash/damage replacement.  Enve wheels are also made in the USA which makes parts availability a snap.  Can't go wrong with Enve products and Backcountry!!!
review.name: Awesome Wheels

review.reviewBody: These exact wheel set is 1400 dollars on ENVE website. I'm not sure why they're so much more expensive here???
review.name: marked up

review.reviewBody: You have to run tubeless tires but they don't come with the tubeless tape preinstalled which has been a huge pain. My local bike shop and myself have not been able to get the tape to hold pressure like it should I believe due to a indentation in the mold. I can't count the number of flats I have gotten with these wheels anymore.
review.name: Nothing but issues with these wheels
comment: Odd, mine setup pretty flawless.  Consider using a tube after you tape them over night to really get that tape setup well.

name: 65 Disc Wheelset - Tubeless

hasVariant.description: Buy the Oboz Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Love these boots.  I personally appreciate that Oboz make a non-waterproof mid.  In Colorado it rarely rains long enough to justify wearing waterproof all the time!  I have found that the DWR coating on the shoes is more than enough for an afternoon thunder storm!

Overall the fit is great.  I am a 13 and my width is a C width and they fit perfect.  I will say that these fit different than the old sawtooth but that isn't a bad thing.  They have a more performance fit and my foot tends to feel more secure in the boot which is great!!

Highly recommend for anyone wanting a quality, durable shoe with the best support out of box of any brand!!
review.name: AMAZING BOOTS!  Fit great!

review.reviewBody:
I've only been using these a few weeks so I can't speak to their longevity, but overall these are pretty decent boots. 

I typically wear a size 9 US, and got these in a 9 Wide and they're a perfect fit, sizing is spot-on. The soles and fit are very comfortable, with just the right amount of support for on-trail backpacking without being too stiff. I have found that the collar of the boot is a bit too stiff and lacks padding, so it does bite uncomfortably into my ankle. This has gotten a little better as the boots break-in, but still hasn't gone away yet. The lacing system is a bit cumbersome as well, but only because I'm more accustomed to wearing high-end boots with rollers or bearing that make lacing adjustments a breeze - the cloth loops on these boots just take a bit more work to get the lacing adjusted to fit just right.

Besides those two things though the boots are very good, however the O-Fit insole they use is EXCELLENT, and easy the best stock insole I've ever found in a boot. Very comfortable with plenty of arch support and a great heel cup, I wish every boot manufacturer included insoles this nice with their boots!
review.name: Decent boot, Great Insole!

name: Sawtooth X Mid Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Perfect for the winter months, keeping feeet nice and warm, also allowing you to use them outdoors for trips to the bin etc.

Highly recommend
review.name: Lovely pair of quality slippers

review.reviewBody: I had a number of these slippers when the fur was shearling and they were the best.  They now charge more and use faux fur that doesn't hold up and makes your feet sweat.
review.name: Not made like they use to be
comment: Hello KLM, we appreciate you sharing your feedback and we're sorry NAKISKA™ Slide II Women's Slipper didn't meet your standards. We will inform our product team of your concerns and ensure this is fixed for the future.

review.reviewBody: Great slippers.  I have had several pairs over the years, and they are the best!!!
review.name: Great slippers!

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and obviously well made. I have outdoor slippers (slipper Crocs) and needed some indoor ones. These would work for both, as in getting the mail, but I will keep them indoors. They were a bit snug with the fluff at first, so I thought I should've ordered up, but after a few wears the size is perfect.
review.name: Great Slipper

review.reviewBody: These slippers are great. After about a year they get packed out but I have put them in the washing machine before… Just don’t put them in the dryer because the rubber bottoms will get sticky. The only reason I gave a four star review instead of a five star review was because of the cost… I think they’re too expensive. But overall they are great slippers.
review.name: Expensive but great slippers.

review.reviewBody: I have 2 pairs of these. I’ve worn a hole in the sole of the one or I have. Had them 2-3 years. Wear them a lot!!
review.name: You can wear inside/outside

review.reviewBody: Great sleepers. Warm and comfortable and very stylish
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love these slippers.  I have had a pair on my feet for over 15 years.  I ordered 2 pair about a year ago.  The pair I’m currently wearing is a disappointment.  The bottom sole is coming off the slipper part and now they are floppy.  I think the glue is not working.  I’m hoping Sorel has great customer service.  I want my NAKISKA™ SLIDE II WOMEN'S SLIPPERs back!!!
review.name: First pair in many, many years that has been a disappointment
comment: Hello Janice, we want to extend our apologies concerning your experience. We pride ourselves in maintaining the highest quality standards for our customers and apologize we missed the mark here.

review.reviewBody: I’ve been purchasing for well over 10 years. Love these slippers they are very supportive and comfortable. I wear them all the time while I’m home.
review.name: perfect support
