review.reviewBody: love the color and style, these gloves saved my hands during a long trip. I measured my hands before buying and bought a size xs based on the numbers provided. they fit great on the actual hand but are a little snug around the fingers. would be easier to remove if there were loops on the index and pinky finger as well and/or the loops were positioned higher on the glove.
review.name: great quality, tedious to remove

review.reviewBody: Great for rope work in both indoor and outdoor use. The suede shed a little when I first got them but no that their broken in it’s great. Can be a little tight on large fingers, had to size up but love these.
review.name: Great gloves

review.reviewBody: Fit guide is pretty accurate. They're lightweight and seem durable where it counts.
review.name: Just as expected

review.reviewBody: These gloves are great! One issue is why I gave them 4 stars. The sizing states that they run true to size, but for me, they ran small, so I went up one size. Great glove but cost me $6.95 return fee.
review.name: Love the design and quality

review.reviewBody: Seem good quality, but sized a little small.  I normally wear a L glove, should have bought XL.  can barely get my hands in and out of the large.  I suggest erring on the side of a larger glove than you think you need
review.name: Not bad

review.reviewBody: They are as I expected, well made, good attention to detail - feel like a second (more durable) skin.
review.name: dig'em

review.reviewBody: I bought these to use hiking..as I cap my hand over the top of my trekking poles on the descents...I also do trail maintenance with an 18" saw , the gloves work great. The added loops for removing them is a nice feature.
review.name: Rock gloves

review.reviewBody:
First off, I like the gloves. Enough to pay more than I bought them for to have a seamster friend repair them. I'm just tired of returning stuff. VERY light use caused the single, straight stitched (bad call OR) line to break and separate the cuff from the palm. Take note lazy manufacturers: this is PRIMARY stress point for donning/doffing the gloves, as evinced by the near instantaneous unstitching of that line. My seamster agreed that it should have been A) a more robustly stitched line, and B) a zig-zag stitch that allowed for some stretch. They fit my hands well once on so they are not too small. Is this indicative of a slide in quality thanks to Dan Nordstrom's (yep, that Nordstrom) acquisition of OR similar to Columbia's Mountain Hardwear acquisition (and subsequent sliding into a vanity outdoor brand position) type of scenario? Dan? Are you going to put OR's good name at risk in pursuit of cutting corners and profits?

The internet has created an environment for high-quality, small manufacturers to compete, albeit not on the same profit-scale, with the Big Guys. Even if that's not your definition of competing, I for one, am tired of the dilution of quality thanks to corporate buy-outs of companies with once-high brand equity. I've already returned another OR piece of gear this year (OR Cirque II Pant) for crap quality zippers on the leg cuffs breaking under minimal stress. 

I'm just hoping the material holds up after I more than double the cost of the product by having them restitched.
review.name: Pathetic stitching strategy.

review.reviewBody: The finish of the gloves is well-done, they are pretty breathable and have a series of thoughtful touches like the loops near the wrist and backs of the fingers. I will admit that I have large, wide hands and that probably relates to my biggest concern: their durability. I ordered an XL and found them to fit quite tight across my palm and fingers. I hoped they would loosen up in time, but after three days of moderate cragging the stitching is coming out on two fingers. I suspect the seams will fail with any more use. Other than that, they appear well made.
review.name: Durability concerns

review.reviewBody: size up one size if you like your gloves comfortably loose, otherwise they may feel constrictive. My hand measured at the lower end of size Large, but I found them a bit tight when I received them.
review.name: run small

name: Fossil Rock II Glove

description: Buy the Patagonia Terrebonne Joggers - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Terrebonne Joggers - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Patagonia Terrebonne Joggers - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great pair of joggers. The material is super light but doesn't feel fragile. The waistband is not restricting, which I appreciate during casual dog walks. However, it offers a tie so you can secure it during more active trail runs. The wind resistance is good for how light the material is - perfect for Spring runs. I would combine it with a base layer on colder Winter days. Out of the box, I was surprised by how light pants are - packs very easily.
review.name: Versatile pair of light joggers

review.reviewBody: I grabbed a pair of these but found them to be a little lesser quality than the similar lulu jogger pants. The lulu ones have better ankle cuffs (with zippers) and a better quality waistband. I also found the fit to be just a baggy through the crotch/butt- kind of parachute pant like rather than being a trim cut. I'm 6'/ 160 and had a medium- would try a small next time (I prefer a slim/ athletic fit).
review.name: Less quality than similar lulu joggers

review.reviewBody: These pants are amazing. Do yourself a favor and buy a pair. I initially saw these pants a few years ago when my younger brother bought a pair. My first impression was that they were very tin (which they are) and that they wouldn't hold up to anything. I was wrong. Fast forward 2 years and my brother and put them through all sorts of adventures, and they still looked brand new. I hopped online and snagged a pair. They were so comfortable that I bought a second pair the same day. Love them for travel, running, hiking, lounging around, etc. They are break the wind very well and handle light precip with ease. If they do get wet, they dry very quickly.
review.name: The Holy Grail of Pants

review.reviewBody: I do like these I usually where a large in patagonia gear.. but these are too tight for my calves.. so size up if you don't want the squeeze..
review.name: If you have large calves size up

review.reviewBody: Love these. Super comfortable. Light. Def worth it.
review.name: Love these

review.reviewBody:
Seriously, buy them, they are perfect for almost any activity, weigh nothing and take up no packing space, and fit like they should. Also, Its 2021 and I'm sure your reading this review while your working from home answering emails like the rest of us - I haven't worn pants with a button snap in what feels like eons, These are the GO-TO's for day to day. 

I also pair these with a Tropic Comfort Hoody when fishing on even the hottest sunny days, they aren't the most durable, but offer the best Sun protection ever, and dry super quickly without being hot at all. 

One Con, and this is almost a stretch, is the waist band. It could definitely be more robust, as to not just roll up on itself like a pair of boxer briefs'. Would be easily accomplished with a slightly thicker elastic band and a little more reinforcement threading.  Lets go Worn Wear team!!!
review.name: Just Buy These in Every Color, trust me.

review.reviewBody: Purchased these for a lightweight backpacking/hiking/trail running option. Super lightweight, comfortable, great fit, and seemingly durable. Basically lived in these for 6 days - love everything about them.
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: I've owned these joggers for 2 years and have finally felt I can give them my honest review. BUY THEM NOW! These pants have been my companion on every adventure for 2 years and have never failed me. There comfy and breathable, water resistant and quick drying! I've worn these in caves and up walls! they have been on my body on every climbing route I?ve been on for two years! So a few hundred routes! I Wear them to the climbing gym to! And to get groceries! These are the only Joggers, you will ever need!
review.name: The Best Joggers Ever!

review.reviewBody: I got these with the full intention of wearing them all the time. Well, might need to get another pair in another color! Very comfy, and surprisingly water resistant.
review.name: Great pantaloons!

review.reviewBody: Bought this from my local running shop because they talked me into stability shoes given my mild overpronation. Big mistake. The stiff sole gave me hip pain after just 4 miles. In addition, I didn’t love the scratchy upper. They went right back for a pair of ASICS Gel Nimbus 26s, which were better. Both shoes are similarly narrow through the mid foot, which was good for me. The ASICS were considerably softer.
review.name: Stiff sole

review.reviewBody: My son requested these because he had Achilles tendonitis and they were recommended. They helped him so much, but after 3 weeks the black part on the bottom of the shoe is coming apart. I'm about to try super glueing them and hope that gets him by for a while, but I'm highly disappointed since it was such an expensive purchase for me. They are wonderful shoes, other than that.
review.name: Wonderful until they started falling apart

review.reviewBody: I have only worn the Arahi 7s one day. They are beautiful and appear to be of the usual first-rate Hoka quality. I love my Gaviota 5s, so I'm still trying to decide which I like better, but I like to wear a different pair of shoes every day, so I may never decide.
review.name: So far, so good.

review.reviewBody: I retuned them after a few days. They were not comfortable for me to wear walking or running. However, they did look nice.
review.name: Look good but not comfortable to wear

review.reviewBody: Fine, firm, supportivee shoe but the Arahi 7 seems to have a bit shorter tongue then the previous versions. I have to dig through the laces to pull the tongue tight/flat before tying
review.name: Tongue should be longer

review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of these shoes, but in this updated model, they have added a plastic piece that lines the lace holes and wraps around your ankle. When walking, this part digs into my ankle and hurts. I wish it was a softer plastic or just on the laces and not wrapping the ankle
review.name: I want to say i love them but ...

review.reviewBody: these shoes are live savers i had brooks before man then are a hole lot better than brooks would recomend these to any one in need of good shoes
review.name: I would buy this product again in a heart beat

review.reviewBody: I use for gym , walking and cycling. I previously had Rincon 3 and loved them. So far not overly empressed with the Arahi 7. Reason is that they are not as comfortable. Same size feels smaller than Rincon. Hopefully they break in better than so far.
review.name: my new Arahi 7

review.reviewBody: I have worn Arahi 4., 5 & 6, men's 10 regular. The Arahi is as was cautioned in several reviews too narrow for me. I will go to a local retail store where I can try on both wide and regular
review.name: Arahi Fit Has Changed

review.reviewBody: Great sneakers. The Arahi 7's are perfect and this color is awesome.
review.name: Great sneakers!

name: Arahi 7 Running Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: Not sure what happened to mystery ranch but the scree 22 is probably the best designed daypack ALL around. This would be like the 40th pack i have ran into the ground in 55 years. Perfect!
review.name: Best day pack design ever

review.reviewBody:
I received this a day before my trip so I had to try it out. I packed it up to use as a carry on for my flight. The size is great as it fits in the scanner trays and fits under your seat. Had a couple spill their drinks on it when it was under the seat. I thought it would be stained for sure. Pulled it out and shook it and the drinks just dripped off. Wiped it off with a napkin and it is dry and like new. When I got to my destination I packed it up and used it hiking. I like how you can use the side straps to make it smaller to keep things from moving around. Only have had it for a short time but the fabric is doing extremely well. 
Thank you
review.name: Just Wonderful

name: Scree 22L Backpack

review.reviewBody: Fantastic carabiner for organizing nuts to avoid having to search around on your rack for the "one" when you need it most.
review.name: Perfect accessory for multiple devices

review.reviewBody: Love the snag-free design. I use these dedicated to each of my aid ladders and ascenders (upper hole for locking rope)
review.name: Love these Keylock Ovals

review.reviewBody: The oval shape is best for storing nuts. The wires just sit better than a normal carabiner. With the shape, sometimes it's a little hard to tell which side opens. I put colorful tape on the not-gate side to easily tell.
review.name: Holds My Nuts

review.reviewBody: Keylock nose carabiner for racking a set of nuts. What’s not to love? Nuts are now easily accessible and don’t get snagged on the nose when unclipping.
review.name: No snags

review.reviewBody:
Old Standards, hollow Salewas, several iterations of generic oval biners and most recently, the BD wiregate ovals aren't as roomy or as less likely to snag on webbing, pitons or wires as the keylock.

Full size biners rule.
review.name: Size matters!

review.reviewBody: I use these to hold my wires, there’s no better carabiner for the job.
review.name: Good Carabiner

review.reviewBody: Opens, closes, opens again and holds me up in between
review.name: Does what it should

review.reviewBody: Using it for the Nuts, I like it a lot. The only problem with this use is that you can't easily figure out what side is opening.
review.name: Solid Carabiner

review.reviewBody: A little on the heavier side but exactly the carabiner you can count on in any situation.
another classic from BD although it is a little bigger then omega ovals
review.name: Another classic

name: Oval Keylock Carabiner

review.reviewBody:
Pros: I love this backpack. When I tell you Thule put engineering into this, they really did to ensure the purpose of this pack was achieved. Slots for clothes, laptop, tons of micro storage. With careful stuffing I was able to load for a 4 day bikepacking adventure (no camping gear). Zippers are waterproof and comes with a integrated rain fly which also is reflective. Looks great. 

Cons: the zipper attaching the backpack to the flip board which attaches to the panier rack unzipped twice over the course of 100miles almost causing me to dump the bag in traffic. Not goof! I also did max the capacity and possibly the weight. Second, would he great if it had a place for water storage e.g camelback or water holder. That being said the look is sleek as is. Lastly, does take some tweeking and adjustments when switching from backpack to bike bag.
review.name: Great backpack/bike bag (some snags)

name: Paramount Hybrid Pannier

review.reviewBody:
I had an incident in the Cohuttas where I broke my paddle and had to leave my boat and hike out through the wilderness.  The river had taken my shoes during a swim, and I hiked for around four hours with only the socks of this dry suit to protect my feet, which otherwise would've been shredded.  The socks of course eventually got small holes in them, but the dry suit held up to hours of crawling and sliding through thorns and rocky terrain.  I was extremely thankful for this suit.

One other thing that I like about this suit is that the front zipper does not go down into the tunnel like some other brands.  So this means less water gets into the tunnel and behind your skirt.
review.name: Very tough dry suit

name: Odin Drysuit

review.reviewBody: Perfect size, great choice of internal pockets. Others don't like the water bottle external pockets but I carry everything inside and secure so that isn't an issue for me. Perfect for personal item size on even the pickiest of airlines.
review.name: Love this backpack!

review.reviewBody: This is by far the best backpack I've ever had. I got it two years ago and it still looks like new. The compartments are cleverly laid out, the inner mesh pockets are just perfect, and the top pocket is safe and accessible. I love it.
review.name: Just perfect

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this bag. Surprisingly, it feels smaller than what I'm used to, but it has better organization, and I can fit everything I need into a more compact space. As a math grad student, I need to carry my laptop, chargers, a couple of books, clipboard, paper, etc., and this holds it all easily. It's comfortable, and the material feels very durable. I plan to wax it regularly to waterproof it as I live in one of the rainiest cities (and sometimes the actual rainiest) city in the US. Got rained on with it my first day of having it, and it protected my  papers, books, laptop and electronics just fine, though you should always take extra precaution and wrap your laptop in plastic just in case, as I do.
review.name: Comfortable, durable, organized

review.reviewBody: Great bag, really durable and has a lot of storage. I only am removing 1 star because it can’t sit up on its own, the bottom is not flat.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody:
Got this two months ago for mainly for work, with the option to use in other activities.  Lots of compartments and room for my laptop, accessaries, personal items like phone and wallet, and my lunch. Easy to organize items. The straps are cushioned but very stiff (may need more time to work in). I wish I noticed more closely it did not come with a chest strap or even an area to put one (unless I’m missing something). Major downer as I could have used this for trail rides on my bike. The side pockets for water bottles are roomie, but could use elastics as other reviews stated. Nothing has gotten wet so far, so I will take waterproof for the win. 
I regret buying this bag due to limited uses without the chest strap option (I will blame myself for that).
review.name: Roomie but limited function

review.reviewBody: I got this to carry my heavy work laptop and other essentials … it has helped my back pain as it is very sturdy and supportive. The chest straps can be a bit odd if you have specific upper body anatomy but you can adjust them to a certain extent . Looks very classy as well
review.name: Very sturdy and strong

review.reviewBody: I have used this backpack for one day, and I can already tell that it will be an all-time favorite next to my old State bag. This is my first Fjällräven. The simplicity of the Kånken was appealing to me, but I was concerned about not having pockets and compartments to organize all the things. The Räven has those and a sleek, minimal design. Its quality can be felt and seen. I went with the 28L because I often need both my laptop and tablet, 13” and 11” respectively. Mine is Deep Patina which, to my eye, is darker in person than the pics on the site.
review.name: Yay, Pocket & Compartments!

review.reviewBody: Great storage and lots of compartments. I am able to keep my laptop and iPad in separate compartments within the laptop sleeve and fit a book between them which is game changing as I travel for work constantly. The only con is that the waterbottle compartment have NO STRETCH and my water bottles constantly fall out if the bag is not upright :( if I had to choose a new bag again I wouldn’t choose this one for that reason
review.name: Good bag bad for waterbottles

review.reviewBody: Very disappointed with this purchase. The fabric is stiff and has no stretch.Padding on the straps is abrasive and uncomfortable.I  suspect it will likely ruin my T-shirts fr chaffing when I'm out hiking.
review.name: Disappointing purchase

review.reviewBody: I bought this backpack a year a go and it works great except when i pack it all up my water bottle doesn't fit!
review.name: Love This Backpack Except...

name: Raven 28L Backpack

review.name: Good Product

review.reviewBody: I have other steel bottles, not Camelbak, that keep cold and ice doesn’t melt quickly despite the heat. This steel Camelbak does not keep the fluid cold and the ice melts quickly. I used both my new Camelbak and my non-Camelbak steel bottle on a long bike ride. My knock-off stayed cold whereas the Camelbak heated up. Disappointing.
review.name: I have other steel bottles,

review.reviewBody: I'm looking for both the pros and cons for this water bottle and can find no reviews below 5 even though, according to the reviews graph, there are 69 reviewers that gave this product 4 or less.
review.name: Why are there no posted reviews lower than 5?

review.reviewBody:
I recently got an Insulated Camelback Podium bottle with dividend money at REI. I must say I'm surprised by all of the good reviews, because when I fill mine with cold water, and even ice cubes, by the time I drive to my starting point and get things out of the car, the water is approaching the ambient temperature. It's been a warm summer, so I'm drinking 80°+ water. In addition, if water has been in the bottle for a few hours, there's a definite "plasticky" taste.

I do like the valve on the cap. You have to squeeze it to deliver water and it won't spill. Plus, you can lock it, so spillage is pretty much non-existent. I do like that part. It's been semi-retired to nightly use as my night stand water bottle. Cats can't dump it :-)

But, overall, while not terribly expensive, I'd still look around a bit before I buy my next bottle.
review.name: Insulated?

review.reviewBody: Easy to squeeze and keeps water cold.
review.name: Easy to squeeze and keeps

review.reviewBody: I've been using it about 2 months now. The biggest strengths are the layout of compartments, ease of organization, and comfort. I understand some people's frustration with the hinge/lock mechanism for the main compartment. It's a little annoying but once I learned the right way to pull it out, it's not an issue anymore. I especially love that the handles are very tight against the body of the bag so it doesn't get stuck on things when I'm putting it in and out of my car or closet. I think the biggest thing I would change about this backpack is weight. Coming from a 10 year old Osprey that weighed basically nothing, this backpack can feel really heavy with just a laptop and iPad. But, again it is comfortable. There's no perfect backpack, sadly, but this one checks all my most important boxes.
review.name: Almost exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: So far my husband loves this bag. Lots of pockets for traveling and laptop use. Fingers crossed it last a long time.
review.name: So far husband loves it

review.reviewBody:
I bought this as a backpack that could hold a decent amount of items for travel, but is not a "travel" backpack that is designed to carry a ton of clothing or shoes. 

I originally bought the Nutria color thinking it was caramel-khaki like you see in work wear. It's actually an ugly green yellow that is not attractive at all. The product photography does not match at all. I'd avoid that color completely and purchase black because it is unclear what color the green would be. 

The pockets are well thought out and I think the way to access to main compartment is really clever. The main compartment is a large open compartment with 3 folio like sleeves attached to the back of the bag. You could fit two laptops and a tablet into these sleeves and they are accessible through the zipper on the back or by flipping the the top back and unzipping the compartment there. The main compartment is accessible from one side through a side opening zipper that reminded me of photography backpacks. The other side was a long storage compartment with several stash pockets and a zippered compartment, which was surprising and really well thought through! The top zippered compartment on the top flap was smaller than I expected and would really function more as a quick stash spot for a phone when going through security than a long term storage location. The sunglasses holder is really just for a pair of sunglasses without a case so not ideal in my opinion. There is a simple front pouch that went the full length of the front.
review.name: Well thought out backpack but color not as expecte

review.reviewBody: Able to pack almost anything you need to be productive in any locale. Sturdy, spacious and utilitarian. Hard to imagine any improvements to this design.
review.name: Great way to carry your office on your back...

review.reviewBody: I have had Thule bags for 14 years now, along with bags by Cotopaxi, Osprey, etc. This is the best day to day bag I have found. Organization is next level, and the support makes a bag full of MacBook Pro 15, books, chargers, snacks, etc etc feel light. Bonus is that it’s way more stylish than older versions.
review.name: Best bag I’ve owned

review.reviewBody: Two work trips and the center strap buckle is broken.
review.name: Two trips broken buckle

review.reviewBody:
I really wanted to love this backpack. The material was great, the zippers were sturdy, and it had SO MANY POCKETS. That being said, I have three notes. 

Note number one was IT DIDN’T FIT ME. I’m 5’2”, and the bag hung uncomfortably low on my back. To compensate, I had to tighten the straps so much that they dug into my neck (I’ve never had this happen before?). After carrying it around fully weighted for a day I had terrible neck and back pain. I haven’t encountered this issue before. When my partner tried it on, it fit him perfectly! He said that it was super comfortable. So if you’re above 5’9” my review doesn’t apply to you at all! 

Note 2 was that I wish it had two water bottle pockets. I really enjoy bringing a hot drink and my water bottle with me. This is more a plea to the product designers, please, bring back the two water bottle holders. 

Note 3 was that the clasp and top zippers were challenging to open and close. 

That’s it. Those were my only notes and I am ridiculously picky when it comes to backpacks. I wanted to love this bag, and would have kept it if it had fit my torso. If you’re taller and looking for a stylish commuter with lots of organization, this might be your bag!
review.name: For tall people only!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! This backpack is so nice! My husband will be using this for spotting equipment at the race track! He was very excited and very impressed with the quality! There are so many pockets to organize. It feels very study and well built. We love the green color too!! Overall, a 10/10!!
review.name: Such a nice backpack!!

review.reviewBody: I’m really pleased with my backpack, it’s comfortable, the materials are really high quality, the size perfect to carry my laptop and gym gear (shoes/clothes), the look is just amazing!
review.name: Great back pack!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve just purchased the first of what will certainly be multiple Thule backpacks. I am beginning a new job and needed a backpack that will look professional when I have meetings following travel. This bag is beautifully organized with direct access to my computer as well as plenty of pockets for all the other work & travel necessities. The exterior is thick, the bottom  is reinforced and the bag fits comfortably and doesn’t make my back sweat, On a day off I went for a couple hour hike and took the bag with me and was happy everything inside stayed dry. 

My only concern is that for longer trips I will probably need more room, That’s OK, I’ll get something a bit bigger too. In total I’ve used the bag on three trips so far and each time people asked about the bag because they didn’t know Thule made bags or just to compliment the look.
review.name: Sleek, well built and convenient

name: Paramount 27L Backpack

review.reviewBody: This is our 3rd Old Town Kayak and as a family we love them! Both the PDL and AP models are very well thought out and designed extremely well.
review.name: Happy Angler

review.reviewBody: Ok so this kayak , I have the 136 , is superior to anything else in tide waters. When dealing with current and wind , it just can not be beat. You do not have to drift fish. I point the kayak where I want it to go, and I turn the speed up till I barely start to move and then I just fish a popping cork for reds. Any direction I choose. Its got a Dakota Lithium 100 AH battery on it which is incredible. After 8 hours on the water , I still have 80 percent of battery left. I have a hummingbird 1198 c on a dakota lithium 18 ah battery and that works all day , no issues. Spot Lock is great , working marsh shorelines , incredible. If I have to paddle , it paddles very well , use a very long paddle. Its a bit wide for stability. Its heavy , so I trailer it and I off load at docks. I do not use kayak launch sites , they are not designed for the kind of outfit I'm running. There are some limitations with current and wind in combination , I wish it had 55 pounds thrust over the 45 , not sure why it does not , and the head should have been an I Pilot Link head instead of just I Pilot. Then it would be perfect. I will ask questions about this.
review.name: Outer Banks Inlet/Soundside Best kayak for this...

review.reviewBody: This kayak is simply great in so many ways. It offers the features that I've been wanting for several years in so many ways - electric, quiet, controllable, powerful - what a pleasure to use.
review.name: Finally, yet I want more

review.reviewBody: I’ve had this kayak for a little over a year and it’s a great fishing kayak. It does have a few problems though. All the bolts come loose from the rudder mount. A bolt from the seat came loose too on the last trip out. Front hatch is definitely not water tight. Also the trolling motor has an issue now due to being in spot lock and the wiring being wrapped around the trolling motor shaft. It will slow down and then speed back up again if I slightly turn the motor direction with the remote. It’s still a good fishing kayak though just needs a few improvements.
review.name: Great kayak but not without its quirks!

review.reviewBody: Purchased in May 2021, I upgraded from a paddle kayak when I found my AP120.  I love to fly fish and this kayak allows me to slowly troll while standing and tossing flies around.  Also the ability to lock into one spot and fish without an anchor is a game changer.  The peddle kayaks are nice but not an option for me because I really enjoy standing while fishing most of the time with the option to sit when desired.  Kayak is very stable and I feel completely balanced while standing.  I use the lead acid battery for the motor and I'm able to fish two full days on the water sun up to sundown without having to recharge the battery.  I've taken it out approximately 25 times in 5 months now and absolutely love it! Remote is very user friendly and if you hook into a big one you can quickly turn the motor off  easily with a push of a button while standing if the fish makes a run directly under your Yak.  The only downside is the kayak is heavy especially with a lead acid battery, but a good kayak cart takes care of that.  highly recommend.
review.name: Absolutely!

review.reviewBody: My new best friend. I can't say enough about the hands free advantages. Spotlock is a game changer.
review.name: Great for crappie brushpiles

review.reviewBody: I went back and forth between The 106 Sportsman powered by MK and the Auto Pilot. I pulled the trigger on the Auto Pilot and I am so glad that I did. Not having to fuss with an anchor anymore is a total game changer. The boat is stable, and super comfortable to be on the water for extended periods of time. There is ample storage and very well though our features every where you look. I fish in south west Florida, and it is incredible to be able to stand and sight fish Snook, and Reds on the flats while controlling the kayak from the remote!!! I would buy this kayak again no hesitation!
review.name: 11 out of 10. Over and beyond!

review.reviewBody:
I have been fishing from the AutoPilot 120 for about 6 months in a variety of conditions and I am extremely pleased with capabilities of the is kayak. I have always been a bit skeptical of "motor powered" kayaks but the technological features of the AutoPilot intrigued me. As someone who does a lot of trolling the ability to maintain a constant troll speed in the face of wind and current is absolutely amazing. I frequently use the heading feature to "set it and forget it" and am able to have everything prepped by the time I get to the fishing grounds or get back to the launch. 

The real magic of this kayak is built into the motor which I power with a lithium 100ah battery. I've never come close to draining the battery even with 10+ hrs on the water. Deploying and stowing the motor is easy. The deck and storage space is more than ample. The chair is very comfortable. 

If I had to be nit-picky my biggest complaints would be that the gear track is too far forward forcing me to use extensions on my rod holders to make them reachable when trolling and limited access to the inside of the hull.
review.name: A Leap Forward for Kayak Fishing

name: Sportsman Autopilot 120 Kayak

review.reviewBody: I've had several pairs of the older North Face variety of convertible hiking pants, which were all perfectly comfortable, but I like these WAY better!  These are very lightweight and plenty of stretch, so they fit and don't look so blah like the other ones often would.  They are actually flattering.  Plus the shorts are longer which I love as well.  And good very deep pockets and a zip pocket too.   I am 5'5", about 116 lobs and got a size 4 and they fit perfectly. Really awesome!
review.name: Fantastic convertible pants!

review.reviewBody: These are great for hiking in the Northeast US where it can be extremely humid and buggy and there is a lot of foliage and snakes on the trails. I prefer to wear pants for the protection but love that I can zip/vent the legs or zip the legs off completely (which I also do for the ride home). The materials is also lightweight. I am 5' 5" and 120 pounds and the size 2 short fit perfectly without the leg cuffs dragging on the ground at all. I got these in 2 colors.
review.name: Perfect Summer Hiking Pants In NE US

review.reviewBody: Just returned from my 2nd 10-day backpacking trip using these pants. 8/10 days of rain yet they dried very quickly. Also very durable given the rough terrain we hiked through. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Light, durable, dries fast

review.reviewBody: These pants are so comfortable and the fabric is really nice. The pockets are substantial (which you don't always find in women's pants). They were still a bit too long for me but I have had them altered. I will be wearing these when we go to Italy in the fall.
review.name: Women's Ferrosi Convertible Pants

review.reviewBody: The shorts part is a little longer than I expected. They sit just above my knees. Deep front pockets which I like. Zippers feel Like good quality. Overall I would recommend
review.name: So far they are comfortable

review.reviewBody: I am 5'6, 155 lb and ordered a size 6 originally but it was just a bit too tight in the hip and thigh, which surprised me as size 6 typically works across a variety of brands. I returned the 6 and ordered size 8. The hip area was looser but the thigh area, especially where the zip-off is is still skin tight. The material is definitely stretchy so the tightness is not uncomfortable but just strange that this aspect did not change when upgrading a size. Despite struggling to figure out sizing, I am impressed by the material, the softness, the soft waistband to prevent rub, the stretch and overall look of the pants.
review.name: Sizing Difficult but Overall Good Pants

review.reviewBody: So comfortable and lightweight, great for hiking with lots of pockets
review.name: I would buy this again

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wore my new Ferrosi convertible pants on a 12 mile hike in Rocky Mountain National Park. The morning started at around 72 degrees so I left them as pants and zipped off the legs after about an hour when the day started getting really warm. As we reached the summit a summer storm brought a 20+ degree temp drop and some serious rain. I zipped the pant legs back on and I was surprised at how water resistant they were. I didn't stay completely dry but after the storm passed, and the sun came out, everything dried out quickly and it was not uncomfortable or chafing while wet. Overall, the pants were great as shorts - lightweight, flexible and cool when the weather was hot, and also did well in the colder temperatures and rain - they didn't stick to my skin, chafe, or lose their shape. And a light rain wouldn't have soaked through the fabric at all.
review.name: Great in any weather

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these pants. They have just enough stretch for running, scrambling or just plain hiking. The fit was accurate.
review.name: Moves with me

review.reviewBody: (This review was collected as part of a promotion.) I've had a pair for about 15 years and they're really comfortable, light and dry so fast! They're just too big☺️. So I bought the convertible kind, a couple of sizes smaller. I measured carefully and consulted the size chart. I would say that the fit is exactly right: no roominess built in. I wore them on a 10-day backpacking trip and despite the narrow, rugged trail, they still look like new. Recommend these pants!
review.name: Comfortable and durable
